data.title: Good pizza and beer
data.text: I was in town for work with a coworker and decided to stop by. I was impressed by their beer selection. While not amazing they still did have a selection of microbrews. The Neapolitan pizza was good, but not great.  Same for the gnocchi.

data.title: Best pizza ever!
data.text: I love their pizza! A great place! The younger kids love playing wth their own pizza dough while waiting on their meal.

data.title: 5nice place to take a couple people , grab a brew and a pizza, and hang out.
data.text:
I really liked the decor here, the flavor they offered visually...and the overall appearance of the place. The pizza was very good...the nueske's  potato/bacon pie was actually my favorite that we got. The potatos coulda been cooked a bit more, but the taste was pretty dang good anyway.

A couple other choices I tried had "calabrian chiles" on them. A cautionary nibble suggests they are a nice mild roasted pepper....eating a whole one will change your mind...deceptively and sneakily, but a quick douse of water or beer can fix that. 

we had no room left for the gelato, we took half of our pizzas home . Nice local place to try out.

data.title: 1st time visiting this city
data.text: My hubby and I went had a early dinner with our grand daughter. Everyone was welcoming and the food is awesome....we orders a salad to start and it was yummy. Loved the dressing. We order the sausage and peppers pizza it was good...

data.title: It's good Pizza
data.text: I like to sit on the porch; it's like being outside.  Can be very busy, especially during the summer Nightfall free-music Friday events at Miller Plaza.  Very good local and craft beer selections.  My favorite pizza is the (Neapolitan-style) "Sweet Fig" with "Prosciutto, gorgonzola, kalamata olives, goat gouda, homemade fig preserves, arugula, extra virgin olive oil and sea salt."  Wife and I usually split one and a kale salad.  That way we can sample more beers.

data.title: Spaghetti was weird
data.text: I had the spaghetti and meatballs.  Maybe I didn't read the description on the menu fully, but it was not a normal red spaghetti sauce.  I definitely did not care for it, but the bread and meatballs were great.  My wife had the chicken parm and she and I both thought it was delicious.  If we go back, we will definitely be getting the pizza, because we saw several of them and they looked top notch.  Price was a bit steep in my opinion.

data.title: Great find!
data.text: This place has received some great reviews already, and for good reason! Their italian salad is perfect for sharing and our pizza was amazing! Atmosphere is casual.  We had a blast and several families with smaller children seemed quite happy also.  Oh, and don't leave without the gelato.  You'll regret it if you do!

data.title: One of the best pizza places we have ever tried
data.text:
In our travels around the U.S., we are always looking for outstanding neapolitan pizza.  When traveling through Chattanooga, TN we always stop at Community Pie for pizza.  There are lots of combinations, our latest one was sausage and peppers.  Be aware that jalapeno peppers are part of the combo of peppers added.  If you are not a spicy fan, ask that they hold them.  The pie was perfectly cooked with just a bit of char on the crust (we specifically asked for thin and crispy).  Shared with a large Caesar salad, it was the perfect amount of food for two for lunch.  
The interior of the restaurant feels like a pizza place with large booths and communal seating plus an area where large windows can be opened in nice weather giving the feeling "almost" dining outside.

data.title: Lunch in Chattanooga, TN
data.text: We grabbed a quick weekday lunch at this place.  The dining room had a waiting list so we went into the bar and ate at one of the open window lunch bar seats.  The place was a bit too busy to provide the service we expected.  The pizza that we shared was average and the salad was not much better either.  It was OK, for a lunch and would have been disappointed if I had chosen this place for a dinner out with my wife.

data.title: Great Pizza / Laid back Atmosphere
data.text: Very cool, laid back atmosphere with great service and great food. We started with the meatballs which were nice and juicy. Beer and wine selections were very good. Both pizzas we got were exceptional. One was a basic pepperoni, and the other had fig, prosciutto, and arugula. Overall a great place for dinner with the family, with friends, or just for a night out.

data.title: Unique and Delicious
data.text: Italian cuisine with more than just pizza as an opinion, they offer salads, sandwiches, a few classic Italian dishes, craft bear, coffee drinks, and gelato. Our kids were pleased with their choices from the kids menu which was reasonably priced and offered several opinions. One chose spaghetti served with a garlic knot and a side of dried apricots. The other chose a cheese slice. Both were ample portions. They have New York style and another thinner crust style. They have many unique topping combinations. My husband and I ordered the 14 inch half meatball half pepperoni and mushroom both types were delicious. I also ordered a side house salad. This was the best with fresh ingredients and homemade creamy Italian dressing.

data.title: Great food, great service, kid friendly!
data.text: Visiting with our almost 3 year old just for a weekend getaway.  Our food was delicious!  Our server was great!  So glad we tried it!

data.title: Try the gelato!
data.text: Community pie not only offers great pizza, but they have some excellent gelato! You must try some whenever you're in Chattanooga!

data.title: In for a late lunch
data.text: Stopped by community pie after our kids swim meet and we were not disappointed! Kitchen was a little backed up and then our pie ripped as it was being taken out of the oven. Manager (long was the name on the ticket) was super nice and apologetic and made everything right! We will be back :)

data.title: "Amazing and Authentic"
data.text: Wow! This place is amazing and the service and atmosphere was perfect! Sitting in the open air area was awesome for this fall day! Neapolitan and New York Style Pizzas available....Great sandwiches and salads and pasta too! The Arugula Salad was great! Appetizers of meatballs, garlic knots and bruschetta; did I mention grilled cheese and tomato soup Italian style! The turkey Caprese sandwich was great; and on Niedlov's Italian bread, just perfect with Roma tomatoes; and a side of pasta salad!loved this place and of course will be back! Another great place for Downtown Chattanooga! Latte and Espressos offered too.... And homemade Galato too!!!!

data.title: Good place!
data.text: This was a good place to eat. I had the lasagna bolognese and it was very good. My husband and son had pizza and they both said it was good. They serve pizza by the slice or you can get whole pies. Service was excellent too!

data.title: Best pizza in Chattanooga
data.text: When the weather is nice, their patio  is a great place to spend an afternoon. Good regional craft beer selection. Also great gelato.

data.title: Outstanding Pizza!
data.text: They have a lovely open air patio in downtown Chattanooga. The food is delicious & the service is fast!

data.title: Good as advertised!
data.text: Nice atmosphere with numerous craft beers to go with very good food. We had couple of pints and the slice of the day, Drunken Pig, and split a "small" salad. Plenty for a lunch which left room for another beer! Were arm-twisted into trying the pistachio gelato, outstanding! Nice atmosphere, good service. Would do again.

data.title: Good, not spectacular
data.text: My husband and I stopped in for an afternoon snack. He got a slice of cheese pizza (only $3), we shared the garlic knots (heavy garlic), and I tried the Milk and Honey Gelato (more like a super creamy vanilla). It was good, but nothing to write home about.
